provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. Any person who desires to inspect the Register shall -
      ( a ) attend at the office of the Registrar between the hours of 10.00
            a.m. and 3.00 p.m. Monday to Friday;
      (b) execute and deliver to the Registrar a proecipe in Form D of the          F   O D.~
          Schedule; and
      (c)   pay a fee of one dollar for the inspection of the Register.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4. Every application to the Registrar for the registration of a travel
                                                                                    Form 0.
agency shall be in Form B of the Schedule.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5 . The proprietor of a travel agency or, where the travel agency is a
company, its directors shall furnish the Registrar with-
      ( a ) evidence of good character and integrity by way of two recom-
            mendations from commercial banks, solicitors, Justices of the
            Peace or any other persons satisfactory to the Registrar;
      (b) evidence of financial ability to operate a travel agency by way of
            a bank statement or a bank guarantee or other evidence
            satisfactory to the Registrar indicating the availability of
            sufficient funds to provide working capital for at least three
            months to cover such overhead charges as rent, telephone,
            postage, advertisement, lights, staff salaries;
                - -   - -- - - -     -     -   -   -

                              THE TRAVEL AGENCIES REGULATIONS. 1958
                 (c)   a bond with surety, which may be a bonding company, in the sum
                       of one hundred thousand dollars;
                 (d) bonds with sureties in the sum of twenty-five thousand dollars
                     entered into by such members of the staff or agents of the travel
                     agency as the Registrar shall determine.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6.-(1) The proprietor of a travel agency or, where the travel agency is a
           company, its directors shall keep in relation to the operation of the travel
           agency proper books of account with respect to-
                 (a)   all sums of money received and expended by the travel agency
                       and the matters in respect of which the receipt and expenditure
                       take place;
                 (b)   all applications for the booking of passages;
                 ( c ) the assets and liabilities of the company.
                    (2) For the purposes of this regulation, proper books of account shall
           not be deemed to be kept with respect to the matters aforesaid unless there
           are kept properly written up in the English language such books as are
           necessary to give a true and fair view of the state of the travel agency's
           affairs and to explain its transactions.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7.-(1) Every application for the registration of a travel agency shall be
           accompanied by an inspection fee of five thousand dollars.
                   ( 1 ~ )A registration fee of two thousand dollars shall be payable by
           an applicant upon approval of his application for registration and before he is
           issued with a certificate of registration pursuant to these Regulations.
                   (2) On or before each anniversary of the registration of a travel
           agency the proprietor or, where the travel agency is a company, its directors
           shall pay to the Registrar an annual registration fee of one thousand five
           hundred dollars while the travel agency remains in operation.
Form C .       8. A certificate of registration issued by the Registrar shall be in Form C
           of the Schedule.

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9. Deposits or advances on passages shall be kept in a special bank
           account and shall be refundable without any deduction:
              Provided that where a depositor cancels a passage and applies for a refund
           of his deposit or advance in relation thereto a cancellation fee of not more
           than five per cent of the cost of the passage may be deducted by the travel
           agency from such deposit or advance.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10. The travel agency shall issue a receipt for each deposit or advance.
